last_phrase: In conclusion, non-verbal hypnotherapy is an effective technique which utilizes various elements of communication such as proxemics, paralinguistics, gaze, and magnetic passes, among others. By understanding the client's personality type and using the right approach, therapists can induce a state of hypnosis and evoke emotional reactions in their clients. The use of sounds, breathing, and metacommunication codes can also enhance the effectiveness of the therapy. Furthermore, techniques such as fluidification and the swaying test can be used to prepare the client for magnetism and activate the parasympathetic system, respectively. Overall, non-verbal hypnotherapy is a powerful tool for helping clients overcome various challenges in their lives.
